description.narrative: The Anti-Corruption for Trust in Lebanon (ACT) project’s overall objective is to enable the adoption and measurable progress in the implementation of an integrated and targeted approach to preventing and combating corruption that is in line with the National Anti-Corruption Strategy (NACS), Lebanon’s commitments under the UN Convention against Corruption (UNCAC), the priorities set under the Reform, Recovery and Reconstruction Framework (3RF) for Lebanon; and more broadly agenda 2030 and its 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly SDG 16 on “Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions”.
FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Output 4 Corruption risk management mechanisms integrated in key vulnerable sectors

Output 4.1 Percentage of stakeholders (disaggregated by type and gender) with knowledge enhanced as a result of related capacity development support
Output 4.2 Number of sectors with corruption risk assessments and mitigation plans completed
Output 4.3 Number of mitigation actions implemented with successful results documented

target.value: In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 100 stakeholders, including policymakers, government officials and representatives from civil society and the business community, professional associations and syndicates, media professionals and institutions, and with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to enable at least 3 sectors to develop corruption risk assessments and mitigation plans and successfully introduce 5 mitigation actions in each.

In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 200 stakeholders, including policymakers, government officials and representatives from civil society and the business community, professional associations and syndicates, media professionals and institutions, and with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to enable at least 4 sectors to develop corruption risk assessments and mitigation plans and successfully introduce 10 mitigation actions in each

In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 400 stakeholders, including policymakers, government officials and representatives from civil society and the business community, professional associations and syndicates, media professionals and institutions, and with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to enable at least 5 sectors to develop corruption risk assessments and mitigation plans and successfully introduce 15 mitigation actions in each.

title.narrative: Output 3 National Anti-Corruption Institution operationalized and strengthened

Output 3.1 Percentage of stakeholders (disaggregated by type and gender) with knowledge and skills enhanced as a result of related capacity development support
Output 3.2 Level of progress achieved in the implementation of the “capacity development plan”
Output 3.3 State of public perception of the performance of the institution compared to other comparable state institutions (+ / = / –)

target.value: In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 30 stakeholders, including policymakers, NACI officials, government officials and judges, and civil society and media professionals and institutions with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to enable the development of NACI’s capacities in accordance with a clear and measurable plan, while strengthening its performance so as to promote positive public perception thereof compared to other comparable state institutions.

In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 60 stakeholders, including policymakers, NACI officials, government officials and judges, and civil society and media professionals and institutions with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to enable the development of NACI’s capacities in accordance with a clear and measurable plan, while strengthening its performance so as to promote positive public perception thereof compared to other comparable state institutions.

In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 100 stakeholders, including policymakers, NACI officials, government officials and judges, and civil society and media professionals and institutions with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to enable the development of NACI’s capacities in accordance with a clear and measurable plan, while strengthening its performance so as to promote positive public perception thereof compared to other comparable state institutions.

title.narrative: Output 1 Capacity to oversee and monitor national anti-corruption strategy institutionalized and supported

Output 1.1 Percentage of stakeholders (disaggregated by type and gender) with knowledge and skills enhanced as a result of related capacity development support
Output 1.2 Number of works plans for strategy implementation developed in a participatory manner and adopted
Output 1.3 Number of progress reports on strategy implementation developed and published online

target.value: In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 40 stakeholders, including policymakers, government officials, judges, and civil society and media professionals and institutions, with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to provide the primary support needed for the government to ensure the proper implementation and monitoring of the NACS. This is included but not limited to the development of 7 work plans in a participatory manner and their adoption, as well as the development of 2 progress reports on implementation and their publication.

In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 80 stakeholders, including policymakers, government officials, judges, and civil society and media professionals and institutions, with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to provide the primary support needed for the government to ensure the proper implementation and monitoring of the NACS. This is included but not limited to the development of 14 work plans in a participatory manner and their adoption, as well as the development of 4 progress reports on implementation and their publication

In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 120 stakeholders, including policymakers, government officials, judges, and civil society and media professionals and institutions, with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to provide the primary support needed for the government to ensure the proper implementation and monitoring of the NACS. This is included but not limited to the development of 21 work plans in a participatory manner and their adoption, as well as the development of 6 progress reports on implementation and their publication

title.narrative: Output 2 Specialized anti-corruption legislations enacted and supported for effective implementation

Output 2.1 Percentage of stakeholders (disaggregated by type and gender) with knowledge and skills enhanced as a result of related capacity development support
Output 2.2 Level of progress achieved in terms of UNCAC compliance (Good / Average / Poor)
Output 2.3 Number of execution instruments (decrees, guides, websites etc) developed and deployed with project support

target.value: In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 80 stakeholders, including policymakers, government officials, judges, and representatives from civil society, professional associations and syndicates, media professionals and institutions, and the business community, with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to enable Lebanon’s compliance with UNCAC provisions and the introduction of 4 specific instruments for the implementation of anti-corruption bills adopted, including execution decrees, training guides, equipment, and information and communication technology tools.

In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 160 stakeholders, including policymakers, government officials, judges, and representatives from civil society, professional associations and syndicates, media professionals and institutions, and the business community, with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to enable Lebanon’s compliance with UNCAC provisions and the introduction of 10 specific instruments for the implementation of anti-corruption bills adopted, including execution decrees, training guides, equipment, and information and communication technology tools.

In addition to enhancing the knowledge and skills of more than 240 stakeholders, including policymakers, government officials, judges, and representatives from civil society, professional associations and syndicates, media professionals and institutions, and the business community, with emphasis on achieving gender parity and engaging youth in this regard, the project is also expected to enable Lebanon’s compliance with UNCAC provisions and the introduction of 13 specific instruments for the implementation of anti-corruption bills adopted, including execution decrees, training guides, equipment, and information and communication technology tools.

title.narrative: Government's ability to improve the performance of institutions and promote participation and accountability is increased
No. of policy reforms legislated and implementation plans adopted
